articles.title: Kim Jong Il Sends Wreath to Bier of Late Paek Nam Sun
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il Sends Wreath to Bier of Late Paek Nam Sun 
    Pyongyang, January 3 (KCNA) -- Leader Kim Jong Il Wednesday sent a wreath to the bier of the late Foreign Minister Paek Nam Sun, deputy to the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly, expressing deep condolences over his death.

articles.title: Important Days of DPRK Observed
Determinations to Implement Tasks Laid down in Joint New Year Editorial Evinced
articles.content:
Determinations to Implement Tasks Laid down in Joint New Year Editorial Evinced 
    Pyongyang, January 3 (KCNA) -- People of different social standings in the DPRK are firmly determined to thoroughly implement the tasks set forth in the joint New Year editorial calling for ushering in a great heyday of Songun Korea full of confidence in victory, upon receiving the editorial.
 Ri Ul Sol, anti-Japanese revolutionary fighter, said that this year, which will commemorate the 95th birth anniversary of President Kim Il Sung, would instill into the entire army and all the people of the DPRK strong faith that cheers over the victorious Songun revolution will resound all over the land of Korea along with the revolutionary history of the President which has been given steady continuity.
 Hong Song Nam, chief secretary of the South Hamgyong Provincial Committee of the Workers' Party of Korea, stressed that the province is facing difficult and huge tasks this year, but the officials, Party members and other working people of the province are fully confident of victory as they have leader Kim Jong Il at the helm of the revolution.
 It is the unanimous will and pledge of the officials and agricultural workers in the field of agriculture to do farming well this year and thus achieve an epoch-making advance in solving the food problem for the people, said Ri Kyong Sik, minister of Agriculture.
 Ri Ju O, minister of Light Industry, said that he would work to ensure that more consumer goods are supplied to the people this year, noting that the officials and workers in the field of light industry are firmly resolved to intensify the revolution in the field this significant year.    
 Pak Nam Chil, minister of Power Industry, said that the officials and employees of the ministry all out for the onward movement for this year are greatly inspired by the idea and spirit of the joint New Year editorial. He vowed to work hard to bring about a signal boost in the production of electricity with the firm viewpoint that they are the soldiers taking the lead in the building of an economic power.

"Book on Birds in Pyongyang" Off Press
articles.content:
"Book on Birds in Pyongyang" Off Press 
    Pyongyang, January 3 (KCNA) -- The Science and Encyclopedia Press of the Democratic People's Republic of Korea has recently published "Book on Birds in Pyongyang".
 There live more than 440 species of birds in Korea, over 250 of which are found in the Pyongyang area.    
 The book consists of two parts, basic and main.    
 The basic part gives natural and geographical conditions of Pyongyang and the distribution of fauna and flora there as well as the general flying of birds and its adaptation. The main part arranges the 16 orders of the birds in Korea, which had been used so far, into 13 orders according to the internationally recognized classification order and details their looks, habits, distribution and migration. 
 Contained in the book are tens of fragmentary knowledge on alarm signals, flying speed and altitude of birds and others, and how to observe the birds.
 The book helps readers acquire a lot of knowledge on birds such as the assortment and number of birds in the thickly-wooded Pyongyang, their prospect, ecological features and ways of protecting and propagating them.
